lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: You know what? When I moved in here I thought: This is gonna be so great. Just us sisters, back together again like when we were kids, except without that stupid Jill... Oh! Who has gotten fat by the way...

lines.text: Seriously?

lines.text: hm-mmm... Mom said she gained like fifteen pounds.

lines.text: Oh! Oh my God! I thought she was on Atkins.

lines.text: Oh, I can give you that.

lines.text: You can?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah. I just, I kept trying to make you a better person, but you're... you're already a pretty perfect version of what you are.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I would love it. Consider it forgotten... But just so you know... however and whenever you decide to propose, I promise I'll say yes. Whether... whether, you know, it is in a basketball game, or in sky writing, or you know, like some lame guy in a cheesy movie who hides it in the cake.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh my God!

lines.text: Phoebe, I...

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Wait! Oh wait!  Oh no!

lines.speaker: mike
lines.text: Ready?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Uh-huh!

lines.text: Phoebe, I love you. There's no-one else in the world I would ask to marry me... three times. But I wanna take care of you, have babies with you, and grow old with you... Phoebe Buffay, will you marry me?

lines.text: Hey!      Rachel: Congratulations! Wow!!

lines.text: Thank you!  Oh, and I have something for you!

lines.text: Oh, Pheebs, baby, that's nice but, you know what, I think I'm ok. Why don't you give it to one of your other single girlfriends?

lines.text: Hey, I'm sorry, I should have given you guys my black book when I got married! Although it wasn't so much a book as a... napkin. With Janice's phone number on it.

lines.text: I can't believe I'm about to meet Benjamin Hobart. I've always thought of him as one of the people I'd invite to my fantasy dinner party. Do you think there's any chance he'll bring Christie Brinkley or C3PO?

lines.text: Sorry, looks like it's just him.

lines.text: I'm sorry...  Ross Geller... Benjamin Hobart.

lines.text: Oh, well, likewise. Actually, not likewise. I've never heard of you until this morning, but, it's nice to be nice!

lines.text: Thank you! . I can't believe that you chose this restaurant! Do you remember the night?

lines.text: M-m.

lines.text: Well, yes, and now. Yes I did say it, and no, I didn't not say it.

lines.text: I'm sorry. I just haven't seen her for so long! All these feelings are rushing back! I'm starting to realize how much I missed her, and I'm gonna need you to break up with her.

lines.text: No, no, that's ok. You won fair and square. I'm so sad!

lines.text: Oh.

lines.text: Yeah! I... I... I liked it!  But, ehm... my bosses didn't go for it. Stupid sons of bitches!

lines.text: What!? Of course I did!

lines.text: I'm not lying to you, I watched it!

lines.speaker: joey

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I watched it!

lines.speaker: joey

lines.text: No you didn't!

lines.text: The selection committee has chosen the three of you as our finalists today. The ultimate decision will be based upon the answers you give to the questions I ask here. I'm gonna start with Dr. Li. Dr. Li, you claim the field is too reliant on the Linnaean taxonomic system. How do you propose to correct this problem?

lines.text: Well, I believe that the answers lie in the osteological evidence. I plan to begin there.

lines.text: Interesting.

lines.text: Certainly. Very well. And Dr. Geller, when is my birthday?

lines.text: What? I... I...

lines.text: That's not even kinda close!  Dr. Li, how many graduate students you'd be needing?

lines.text: I see, and Dr. Biely?

lines.speaker: benjamin
lines.text: Certainly. Dr. Geller, which 1965 Shirelles hit was later covered by a popular British invasion band?

lines.text: No! I'm sorry, we were looking for "Baby It's You". Baby It's You.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Wha...? Wait, wait, wait, just a minute. None of my questions have anything to do with Paleontology.

lines.speaker: benjamin
lines.text: You're right, I apologize. Scratch the last question. Spell "Boscodictiasaur".

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Ok.  B - O - S ...

lines.text: No, it starts with a silent "M".

lines.text: Oh come on!!

lines.text: Yes, and I have to say, I am not just hurt. I am insulted. When I tell somebody I did something...

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Ok whoah-hey... Let me just stop you right there, ok? First, you lied, right? Then, you lied about lying, ok? Then you lied about lying about lying, ok? So before you lie about lying about lying about lying about... lying...   Stop lying!

lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: This is exactly the kind of social situation that I am not comfortable with!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What kind of social situation are you comfortable with?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: It's just that we've never spent any time, you know, alone together.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You'll be fine. Nah, you won't, but I'll be back in two minutes.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: So, ah... Any plans for the summer?

lines.speaker: erica
lines.text: I don't know. Maybe church-camp?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hah. May not wanna mention this. So, you ever wonder which is worse, you know; going through labor or getting kicked in the nuts?

lines.speaker: erica
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, it's just interesting. You know, because no one will ever know, because no one can experience both.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: One of life's great, unanswerable questions. I mean, who knows? Maybe there's something even more painful than those things? Like this.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Morning.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: What's that?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: It's my house-warming present for Monica and Chandler.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: It's a baby chick and duck!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Uh-huh. And I named them Chick Jr. and Duck Jr.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I did not see that coming.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah, I figure they'll love it at the new house, you know? It has that big backyard. And then, when they get old, they can go to that special farm that Chandler took the other chick and duck to.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah. It's a shame people can't visit there.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: That is the rule, though.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Guess what? You're almost an uncle!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah, Erica went into labor last night. Monica and Chandler are at the hospital right now!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh my God!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah, and I have a definite feeling it's gonna be a girl.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Phoebe, you were sure Ben was gonna be a girl.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Have you seen him throw a ball?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Is Rachel here?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Uh, I think she's still asleep. Hey, hey, how did it go with you guys last night? She seemed pretty pissed at you.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Uh, we, y'know, we worked things out.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: What's that smile? Did something happen with you two?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey, I'm not one to kiss and tell, but I'm also not one to have sex and shut up. We totally did it!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh my God. You and Rachel?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I know, it's pretty great.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: So what does that mean? Are you guys getting back together?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh, I.. I don't know. We didn't really get to talk.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: But do you wanna get back together?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I don't know. It was incredible. I mean, it just felt so right. When I was holding her, I mean, I never wanted to let her go. You know what? Yeah, I do. I wanna be together.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: YAY!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Shhh!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yay!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: So, so is she still going to Paris?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Wow, I hadn't thought of that. I hope not.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh, this is like the best day ever. Ever! You guys might get back together, Monica and Chandler are getting their baby, there are chicks and ducks in the world again! Oh, I feel like I'm in a musical!  "Daa - raa... When the sun comes up, bright and beaming! And the moon comes..."

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Morning!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Guess we'll never know how it ends.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hey.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey. How did you sleep?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Good. You?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Good.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I bet you did!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Uh. Would you guys mind giving us a minute?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Sure, yeah. Will you just keep an eye on the chick and the duck?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Chick and the duck? Didn't they die...

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Dive. Yeah, they dove head-first into fun on the farm.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: So...

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Morning.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: You too. Last night was just wonderful.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: It really was.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I woke up today with the biggest smile on my face.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I know, me too. It was... You know, it was like one of those things you think is never gonna happen, and then it does, and it's everything you want it to be.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Uh-huh. I know. It was just, it was just the perfect way to say goodbye.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: It's just a little bit more, honey.

lines.speaker: erica
lines.text: Help me! This hurts!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Is it really that bad?

lines.speaker: erica
lines.text: Uh-huh! I think it's time to kick you in the nuts and see which is worse!

lines.speaker: doctor
lines.text: The baby's head is crowning.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh! Oh my God! That is the most beautiful top of a head I have ever seen! Chandler, you have to see this!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I'm okay.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Chandler, you don't wanna miss this. This is the birth of your child! It's the miracle of life!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Alright. Wow, that is one disgusting miracle.

lines.speaker: doctor
lines.text: Start pushing. Here we go. Here come the shoulders...

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: It's a... It's a boy!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Wow!

lines.speaker: erica
lines.text: Is he okay?

lines.speaker: doctor
lines.text: He's just fine.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh, you did it!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: It's a baby! A beautiful little baby! And some other stuff I'm gonna pretend I don't see.

lines.speaker: doctor
lines.text: Would you like to cut the umbilical cord?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, that's spongy.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh, hey handsome! Oh, I'm gonna love you so much that no woman is ever gonna be good enough for you!  Oh, we are so lucky!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I know. He has your eyes.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I mean, I know that's not possible, but he does.

lines.speaker: nurse
lines.text: We'll just get him cleaned up a bit.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh my God, he's beautiful. Thank you so much.

lines.speaker: erica
lines.text: I'm really happy for you guys.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: How do you feel?

lines.speaker: erica
lines.text: I'm tired!

lines.speaker: doctor
lines.text: Well, you don't have that much time to relax. The other one will be along in a minute.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I... I'm sorry, who should be along in a what now?

lines.speaker: doctor
lines.text: The next baby should be along in a minute.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: We only ordered one!

lines.speaker: doctor
lines.text: You know it's twins, right?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh, yeah! These are the faces of two people in the know!

lines.speaker: doctor
lines.text: I can't believe you didn't know it's twins! This has never happened before.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, gosh. That makes me feel so special and good.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Wait, did you know it was twins?

lines.speaker: doctor
lines.text: Yeah, it's here in the paperwork we got from the clinic in Ohio.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Anybody tell you?

lines.speaker: erica
lines.text: I don't think so. Although, they did mention something about two heartbeats. But I thought that was just mine and the baby's. They kept saying both heartbeats are really strong, and I thought well, that's good 'cause I'm having a baby.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: This is unbelievable.

lines.speaker: erica
lines.text: Twins actually run in my family.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Interesting!  Can I see you for a second?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: What do we do?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What do you mean "what do we do"?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Twins! Twins!!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Chandler, you're panicking!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Uh-huh! Join me, won't you?! Okay, what do you say we keep one, and then just like have an option on the other one?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: We can't split them up!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Why not? We could give each of them half a medallion, and then years later, they'll find each other and be reunited. I mean, that's a great day for everybody.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay, what if the person who adopts the other one is horrible?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: What if they're not? What if it's adopted by a king?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yeah, because I hear the king is looking to adopt.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Monica, we are not ready to have two babies!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: That doesn't matter! We have waited so long for this. I don't care if it's two babies. I don't care if it's three babies! I don't care if the entire cast of "Eight is Enough" comes out of there! We are taking them home, because they are our children!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay. Shhh...

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay!

lines.speaker: doctor
lines.text: It looks like we're about ready over here.

lines.speaker: doctor
lines.text: Come on, Erica, start pushing again now.

lines.speaker: erica
lines.text: Ow!

lines.speaker: doctor
lines.text: Here she comes!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: She? It's a girl?

lines.speaker: doctor
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, now we have one of each!  And that's enough!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: And then she said it was the perfect way to say goodbye.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh my God! What did you say?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Nothing! What do you say to that?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Ross, you've got to tell her how you feel!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No way!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: You can't just give up! Is that what a dinosaur would do?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Dude, I'm just trying to speak your language.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Ross, Rachel doesn't know that you wanna get back together. If she did, she might feel differently. She might not even go.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: You really think so?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I'm telling you! Oh, okay! This is the part of the musical where there'd be a really good convincing song.  "Bam-bam, don't take no for an answer. Bam-bam, don't let love fly away. Bam-bam-bam-bam..."

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hi!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Can't a girl finish a song around here?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hi! So I just dropped Emma off at my mom's.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh, you're not taking her with you tonight?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: No, we decided that I would go ahead and set up first, and then my mom would bring Emma to Paris on Sunday.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Wow, eight hour flight with a one-year old? Good luck, mom.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Are you kidding? Eight hours with my mother talking about Atkins? Good luck, Emma!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Alright, you know what? You're right. I should at least tell her how I feel.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Ross, wait!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What? What?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Could you get me a muffin?

lines.speaker: gunther
lines.text: Rachel?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.speaker: gunther
lines.text: I... I know you're leaving tonight, but I just have to tell you. I love you.

lines.speaker: gunther
lines.text: I... I don't know if that changes your plans at all, but I thought you should know.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Gunther... Oh... I love you too. Probably not in the same way, but I do. And, and when I'm in a cafe, having coffee, or I see a man with hair brighter than the sun, I'll think of you. Aw.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh... Bye guys.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh my God!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Unbelievable!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey, you know what might help?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I'm not getting you a muffin!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Do you think they recognize each other from in there?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Maybe. Unless they're like two people who have lived in apartments next to each other for years, and then one day they're pushed through a vagina and they meet.

lines.speaker: nurse
lines.text: We're going to take Erica to recovery now.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: There's something that we wanna tell you. We decided to name the girl- baby Erica.

lines.speaker: erica
lines.text: Oh my God, that's just like my name!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Son of a gun, it is!

lines.speaker: erica
lines.text: Anyway, I'm gonna go and get some rest. I'm really glad I picked you guys. You're gonna make great parents. Even Chandler.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay, well, bye!

lines.speaker: erica
lines.text: Bye!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Bye!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: We'll call you!

lines.speaker: erica
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Have fun at church-camp!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh, look at these little bunnies!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I know! You ready to trade?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Alright, let's see..

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: We could trade later.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yeah, I'm good.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hey, what are you working on?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: It's a... It's a "welcome home" sign for the baby.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: How sweet! Oh, is that the baby?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: No, I sat in the paint.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hey. So, did you talk to Rachel?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No, and I'm not going to.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Why not?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Because she's just going to shoot me down. You guys saw what happened with Gunther. That did not look like fun.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: How can you compare yourself to Gunther? I mean, sure, he's sexy in a more obvious way. You have a relationship with her, you slept together last night.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah, and she still wants to go! It's pretty clear where she is.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah, I know what you mean. I mean, sometimes...

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Uh, Joe?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Damn it!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Look, even if I were gonna tell her, I don't have to do it now. Okay? I'll be seeing her again. We've got time.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: No, you don't! She's going to Paris! She is going to meet somebody. Do you know how many hot guys there are in Paris? It's... It's a city of Gunthers!

lines.speaker: mike
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hey! What do you have there?

lines.speaker: mike
lines.text: Oh, I made a little something. If I had more time to work on it, it'd be better, but..

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh my God! You did that yourself?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Honey, that's gorgeous!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: You know, the baby can't read, Mike!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hi! You guys, the car-service just got here. I can't believe they're not home yet! I have to catch my stupid plane. I wanna see the baby!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Monica just called from the cab. She said they should be here any minute. And apparently, there's some big surprise.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah, did she sound happy about it? 'Cause my friend Ethel's baby was born with a teeny, tiny beard.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh my God!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh my God!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hi! Oh my gosh!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hey.

lines.speaker: phoebe, ross, rachel
lines.text: Hey.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey, so what is the big surprise?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh my God!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What... What...

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay, okay, awkward question. The hospital knows you took two, right?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yes, it's twins!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh my God.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh, they're so cute! Now, what, what kinds are they?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: This is a boy,  and that's a girl.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Her name is Erica.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Aw..

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey, that pregnant girl's name was Erica.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yeah. It's a shame you two didn't get to spend more time together.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yeah, we named the boy Jack after dad.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Aw, he's gonna be so happy.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh, Jack Bing. I love that. Ooh, it sounds like a '40s newspaper guy, you know? "Jack Bing, Morning Gazette. I'm gonna blow this story wide open!"

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh my gosh. Wow, so beautiful.

lines.speaker: mike
lines.text: I want one.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh yeah? Well, tell me which one, and I'll try slip it in my coat.

lines.speaker: mike
lines.text: Seriously. Wanna make one of those?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: One? How about a whole bunch?

lines.speaker: mike
lines.text: Really?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah! Ooh, we could teach them to sing, and we can be like the Von Trapp family! Only without the Nazis. Although that sounds kinda dull.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, you guys, I can't believe this. But I'll leave now, or I'm gonna miss my plane.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I'm just so glad you got to see the babies.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Me too. Oh, I'm just sorry I'm not gonna be around to watch you two attempt to handle this! Alright, I can't say goodbye to you guys again. I love you all so much.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I love you.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I love you.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Call us when you get there.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I will. Ross, come here.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I just want you to know.. Last night.. I'll never forget it.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Neither will I.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Alright, now I really have to go. Okay. Au revoir! Oh, they're gonna really hate me over there.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: So, you just let her go?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey, maybe that's for the best.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah. You know? You just... Look, you gotta... You gotta think about last night the way she does, okay? Maybe, maybe sleeping together was the perfect way to say goodbye?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: But now she'll never know how he feels!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Maybe that's okay. You know? Maybe, maybe it is better this way? I mean, now, now you can move on. I mean, you've been trying to for so long, maybe now that you're on different continents..  Right?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Maybe now you can actually do it. You know? You can finally get over her.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah, that's true. Except I don't wanna get over her.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I don't! I wanna be with her.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Really?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah, I'm gonna go after her.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah, you are!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Woo!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Wait, wait! Get your coat! Get your coat!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: My coat...

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: This is so cool!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I have no idea what's going on, but I am excited!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: But Ross, Ross. What do you, what do you think she's going to say?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I don't know, but I.. Look, even if she shoots me down, at least I won't spend the rest of my life wondering what would have happened. Where - where is my coat?!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: You didn't bring one! My cab's downstairs, I'll drive you to the airport.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay, guys, wish me luck.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hurry!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Good luck, good luck!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: There's no seatbelt!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: That's okay. If - if we hit anything, the engine will explode, so you know, it's better if you're thrown from the car.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Alright, alright, let's do this!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Okay!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: man
lines.text: 18th and East End.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I - I don't take passengers.

lines.speaker: man
lines.text: Hey! The law says you have to accept any fare.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No, you don't understand. This isn't a real cab.

lines.speaker: man
lines.text: Alright, I gotta report you. What's your medallion number?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: My medallion number is, "Get out of the cab!"

lines.speaker: man
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Get out of the cab!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Get out of the cab!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh, hey, hey, can I give you guys your house-warming present now?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Now, that you can do.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Alright!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Ah... Chick Jr.? Duck Jr.? Don't hide from mama!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: You can open your eyes now.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Are we off the bridge?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Is the old woman on the bicycle still alive?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yes, she jumped right back up.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh my God, Phoebe, slow down!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Do you wanna get to Rachel in time?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yes, but I don't wanna die in your cab!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: You should have thought of that before you got in!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Toll-booth.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Toll-booth! Four bucks. There are quarters in the glove compartment.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hurry!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Damn, that window is clean.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Quack, quack, tweet, tweet, quack, quack, tweet, tweet, quack, quack, tweet, tweet, quack, quack, tweet, tweet, quack, tweet, quack...

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: We were wondering what was taking so long with the gift, but now we understand you were doing this.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Okay, I wanted to surprise you, but for your house-warming gift, I got you a baby-chick and a baby-duck!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Really? You got us a chick and a duck?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh, great! Just what you want for a new house with infants. Bird feces.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah, yeah, they must have jumped off the table, 'cause now they're gone!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh, don't worry, we'll find them.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Actually, I'm gonna go check on the twins.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Alright.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh God! What did I just step on?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: It's okay, it's just an egg roll.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh..

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: You stepped on my egg roll?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I'm sorry, I didn't know to look for Chinese food on the floor.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Just put it on a plate and leave.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay, let's find these birds.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Alright.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Wait, wait. Do you hear that?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh! They're in the table!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, that can't be good!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: We gotta get them out of there!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: How?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh, oh! Maybe we can lure them out. You know any birdcalls?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh, tons, I'm quite the woodsman.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Well, maybe we can just tip the table a little.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Joey, wait! The ball!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh God! So what do we do?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I don't know. Maybe we can open this up somehow.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: No... It's all glued together.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Does that mean we have to bust it open?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I don't know. Maybe.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh my God!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I know! It's.. It's the foosball table.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: All right, you know what? We don't have a choice. It's like I would have said in that sci-fi movie if I'd gotten the part. "Those are our men in there, we have to get them out! Even if I have to sacrifice the most important thing in my life; my time-machine."

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Did that movie ever get made?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: It did not.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Ross, where are you going?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: To talk to Rachel, isn't that why we took a ride in the death-cab?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: What? What are you just gonna walk up to her at the gate? Have you never chased anyone through the airport before?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Not since my cop-show got cancelled.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: You have to get a ticket to get past security.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What? We're never gonna make it!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Not with that attitude! Now, haul ass!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay, if you could all walk slower, that'd be great.

lines.speaker: gate attendant #1
lines.text: Madame, your passport please?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh my God! I was so afraid I wasn't gonna remember any of my high- school French, but I understood every word you just said!

lines.speaker: gate attendant #1
lines.text: Your boarding pass, please.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, shoot. I had it. Oh, I can't believe this.

lines.speaker: gate attendant #1
lines.text: Madame, if you don't have your boarding pass...

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I have it, I have it, I have it. Oh, okay, I can't find it, but I remember that I was in seat 32C, because that's my bra-size.

lines.speaker: gate attendant #1
lines.text: Madame, you must have your boarding pass..

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay, fine! But you know what? If I was in 36D, we would not be having this problem.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey, I need a ticket.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Just one? I drive you all the way down here, and I don't get to see how it works out?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Fine, two tickets, I need two tickets.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: We're on our honeymoon.

lines.speaker: ticket agent
lines.text: And the destination?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I don't care. Whatever is the cheapest.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I'm so lucky I married you.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh! Shoot! Damn it! Where is it? Oh! Oh! I found it! I found it!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hah! I found it! I told you I would find it! In your face! You're a different person.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay, flight 421 to Paris. I don't see it, do you see it?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: No, did we miss it?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No, no, no. That's impossible. It doesn't leave for another 20 minutes.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Maybe we have the flight-number wrong. God.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hello.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hey, it's me. Here's Ross.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What? Hey, hey, listen..

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh my God! Ross, you wouldn't believe the cute little noises the twins are making. Listen.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Monica? Monica, Monica, Monica, Monica..?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh, I'm sorry. Shoot, they were doing it before.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: That's alright. Listen, listen.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh, wait, wait, wait! Here they go again.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Monica? Monica, Monica, Monica, Monica..?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Isn't that cute?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: That is precious! Listen! I need Rachel's flight information.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh, okay. Alright, it's flight 421. Leaves at 8:40.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yes, that's what I have. It's not on the board.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: That's what it says here. Flight 421, leaves at 8:40, Newark airport.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Newark airport. Why, where are you?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: JFK.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Don't worry, you guys, we're gonna get you out of there.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: And we're also gonna buy you tiny, bird hearing-aids.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Okay. Here goes.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: What's the matter?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I need to say goodbye to the table first.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I understand.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Okay. Table, you have given us so many great times. And you guys, Jordan, Victor, Joel... All of you guys. What can I say? You guys make us look good. You wanna say anything?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I don't know. Except that, for one last time...  Good game, good game, good game, good game, good game, good game, good game.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Okay, here we go. I can't do it.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, I can't do it either.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey! Did you find them?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah, they're stuck inside the table!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: We have to bust it open, but neither of us can do it!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh, well sure. This gotta be so hard. I'll do it. Gimme!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Phoebe! Wow! No, no, no!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well, I've never gone this fast before.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Phoebe, forget it, okay? Newark is - is like an hour away. There's no way we're gonna make it in time.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: She's got her cell, you could call her.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I am not doing this over the phone.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: You don't have any other choice!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hello?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Rachel? Oh, good. Hey, by the way, did you just get on the plane?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: For what it's worth, we would have caught her if we were at the right airport.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yay.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Uh, Rach, hang on.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Phoebe? Is everything okay?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Uhm, actually no. No, you've... You have to get off the plane.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What? Why?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I have this feeling that something's wrong with it. Something is wrong with the left Philange.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, honey, I'm sure there's nothing wrong with the plane.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Alright, look, I have to go. I love you, and I will call you the minute I get to Paris.

lines.speaker: passenger #1
lines.text: Uhm, what was that?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, that was just my crazy friend. She told me I should get off the plane, because she had a feeling that there was something wrong with the left Philange.

lines.speaker: passenger #1
lines.text: Okay, that doesn't sound good.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I wouldn't worry about it. She's always coming up with stuff like this, and you know what? She's almost never right.

lines.speaker: passenger #1
lines.text: But she is sometimes.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well...

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Wait, what are you doing?

lines.speaker: passenger #1
lines.text: Well, I can't take this plane now.

lines.speaker: air stewardess
lines.text: Excuse me, sir, where are you going?

lines.speaker: passenger #1
lines.text: I have to get off this plane, okay? Her friend has a feeling something's wrong with the left Philange.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Could I get some peanuts?

lines.speaker: passenger #2
lines.text: What's wrong with the plane?

lines.speaker: air stewardess
lines.text: There's nothing wrong with the plane.

lines.speaker: passenger #1
lines.text: Yeah! The left Philange!

lines.speaker: air stewardess
lines.text: There is no Philange!

lines.speaker: passenger #1
lines.text: Oh my God. This plane doesn't even have a Philange!

lines.speaker: passenger #2
lines.text: I'm not flying on it!

lines.speaker: air stewardess
lines.text: Ma'am, please sit down!

lines.speaker: passenger #3
lines.text: What's going on?

lines.speaker: passenger #1
lines.text: We're all getting off. There is no Philange!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: This is ridiculous! I...

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah, okay.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Alright. My job here is done.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: That was... Impressive.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah, you didn't even use the tools for most of it!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yeah, they were just slowing me down. Alright, I have to get back to the babies. I'll see you girls later.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Sorry about the table, man.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You gonna buy a new one?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Probably not. Nah. I don't know how much I'm gonna wanna play after you go.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, at least we got these little guys out.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Aww, we were worried about you! Hm. I guess I better get used to things crapping in my hand, huh?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I'm gonna miss these little guys. It was nice having birds around again.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hey, you know what? Maybe we should keep them here with you.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yeah, I mean we've got a lot going on right now. And, plus, here they'd have their own room.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I could get a goose!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You know, I - I think you're set with the poultry.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Thanks man. Did you hear that, you guys? You're gonna get to stay here! And, and it's good, you know, 'cause, 'cause now you have a reason to come visit.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I think there may be another reason. So, awkward hug or lame cool guy handshake?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Uh, lame cool guy handshake, yeah.

lines.speaker: gate attendant #2
lines.text: Ma'am, I assure you, the plane is fine.

lines.speaker: passenger #2
lines.text: And you fixed the Philange?

lines.speaker: gate attendant #2
lines.text: Yes, the Philange is fixed. As a matter of fact, we put a whole lot of extra Philanges onboard, just in case.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Where is she?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I don't see her.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Rachel! Rachel Green!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: There she is!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Rachel! Rachel!

lines.speaker: gate attendant #2
lines.text: Wow, excuse me, sir, do you have a boarding pass?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No, no, I just have to talk to someone.

lines.speaker: gate attendant #2
lines.text: I'm sorry, you cannot go any further without a boarding pass.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No, no, no, but...

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: RACHEL!!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh my God... What.. What are you guys doing here?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Okay, you're on.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What? What? Ross, you're scaring me. What's going on?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay, the thing is..

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Don't go.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Please, please stay with me. I am so in love with you. Please, don't go.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh my God.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I know, I know. I shouldn't have waited 'till now to say it, but I'm.. That was stupid, okay? I'm sorry, but I'm telling you now. I love you. Do not get on this plane.

lines.speaker: gate attendant #2
lines.text: Miss? Are you boarding the plane?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey, hey. I know you love me. I know you do.

lines.speaker: gate attendant #2
lines.text: Miss?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I - I have to get on the plane.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No, you don't.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yes, I do.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No, you don't.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: They're waiting for me, Ross. I can't do this right now, I'm sorry. I'm sorry.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Rachel?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I'm so sorry.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I really thought she'd stay.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I'm sorry.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Well, that's it. Everything's packed.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Wow, this is weird.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I know.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah. Uh, does this mean there's nothing to eat?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I put three lasagnas in your freezer.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I love you!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hey.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: So did you guys make it in time?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah, yeah, he talked to her, but she got on the plane anyway.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Where's Ross?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: He went home. He didn't want to see anybody.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ross, hi. It's me. I just got back on the plane. And I just feel awful. That is so not how I wanted things to end with us. It's just that I wasn't expecting to see you, and all of a sudden you're there and saying these things... And... And now I'm just sitting here and thinking of all the stuff I should have said, and I didn't. I mean, I didn't even get to tell you that I love you too. Because of course I do. I love you. I love you. I love you. What am I doing? I love you! Oh, I've gotta see you. I've gotta get off this plane.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh my God!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Excuse me?

lines.speaker: air stewardess
lines.text: Miss? Please, sit down!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I'm sorry. I'm really sorry, but I need to get off the plane, okay? I need to tell someone that I love love them.

lines.speaker: air stewardess
lines.text: Miss, I can't let you off the plane.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Let her off the plane!

lines.speaker: air stewardess
lines.text: I am afraid you are gonna have to take a seat.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, please, miss, you don't understand!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Try to understand!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, come on, miss, isn't there any way that you can just let me off...

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No! No! Oh my God. Did she get off the plane? Did she get off the plane?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I got off the plane.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: You got off the plane.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I do love you.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I love you too, and I'm never letting you go again.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay. 'Cause this is where I wanna be, okay? No more messing around. I don't wanna mess this up again.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Me neither, okay? We are - we're done being stupid.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay. You and me, alright? This is it.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: This is it. Unless we're on a break.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Don't make jokes now.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay, please be careful with that. It was my grandmother's. Be careful.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: If that falls off the truck, it wouldn't be the worst thing.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Wow.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I know. It seems smaller somehow.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Has it always been purple?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Look around, you guys. This was your first home. And it was a happy place, filled with love and laughter. But more important, because of rent control, it was a friggin' steal!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hey, do you realise that at one time or another we all lived in this apartment?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh, yeah, that's true.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Uh, I haven't.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Wait a minute. What about that summer during college that you lived with grandma, and you tried to make it as a dancer?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Do you realise we almost made it ten years without that coming up?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh, honey, I forgot. I promised Treeger that we'd leave our keys.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh, okay.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: So, I guess this is it.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah. I guess so.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: This is harder than I thought it would be.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh, it's gonna be okay.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Do you guys have to go to the new house right away, or do you have some time?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: We got some time.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay, should we get some coffee?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Sure. Where?
